intro: Sinapis harra, commonly known as wild mustard, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard species. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring slender stems and alternate leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom from spring to early summer. The plant produces small, spherical pods that contain several seeds, which are often used in traditional medicine and as a spice.
